DOC.brief_summary: Intestinal parasitic infection , malnutrition iron deficiency anaemia ( IDA ) still consider public health problem rural Malaysia especially among Orang Asli child . Despite intermittent control programme , prevalence problem still high suggest need control intervention measure . This randomized double-blind , placebo-controlled trial carry among Orang Asli schoolchildren Sekolah Kebangsaan Betau Pos Betau , Pahang ( 200 km northeast Kuala Lumpur ) investigate effect vitamin A supplementation intestinal parasitic reinfections , growth , iron status educational achievement . HYPOTHESES 1 . Vitamin A supplementation negative effect intestinal parasitic reinfections worm burden infection among Orang Asli schoolchildren Pos Betau , Kuala Lipis , Pahang . 2 . Vitamin A supplementation positive effect growth ( weight height ) among Orang Asli schoolchildren . 3 . Vitamin A supplementation effective improve serum iron status among Orang Asli schoolchildren . 4 . Vitamin A supplementation positive effect cognitive function educational achievement among Orang Asli schoolchildren .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Vitamin A Supplementation Intestinal Parasitic Reinfections
DOC.detailed_description: Children Sekolah Kebangsaan Betau Pos Betau , Kuala Lipis , Pahang serve target population study . The selection criterion study subject follow : - Age 7-12 year ( accord birth date birth certificate ) . - Non-menstruating female ( age < 13 ) - No history evidence underlie haematological-related disease thalassaemia ovalocytosis . - No evidence concomitant severe and/or chronic illness acute respiratory tract infection , mental retardation neurological deficit . - Consent parent participate study .
DOC.criteria: Age 712 year ( accord birth date birth certificate ) . No evidence concomitant severe and/or chronic illness acute respiratory tract infection , mental retardation neurological deficit . Consent parent participate study . history evidence underlie haematologicalrelated disease thalassaemia ovalocytosis . menstruate female ( age > 13 )
